answers.answer: You might want to see your Dr to find out what's going on. Are you having any other symptoms like being more thirsty? If I were you, I would ask for a blood sugar test. This may not be the what's going on but it's best to be checked for diabetes.
No, I am not thirsty at all. And nothing I eat tastes good. I don't have a family Doctor or insurance so I thought I would try to figure out what the problem is on my own.

You don't have to be thirsty to have diabetes, and I'm not saying that's the problem. It would be a good idea to be checked for it though. Actually, just the opposite could be going on. Low blood sugar. I know you have to stand up alot at work and that could be a problem if your not getting breaks and sitting. Are you eating and drinking enough throughout the day?

I have just started eating and drinking more. Some one else told me I needed to be doing that. I checked my blood sugar one morning, before eating and it was spot on.Would low blood sugar cause you to feel bad all the time, or just once in a while when your blood sugar drops?

Low blood sugar could cause you to feel bad when it's happening. As long as your eating on a regular basis, every 3 to 4 hours, it should'nt be dropping. I'm not talking about a full meal. Having a healthy snack in between meals is a good idea.What was your number when you checked it that morning?Would it be possible to see a Dr for some testing?

question: I am a 30 year old male. I have always been healthy. My job requires me to be on my feet a lot so I get a lot of walking in during the day. Lately I have been very tired, exhausted actually. Some times I have blurred vision, or a  weak, tired, spacey feeling.  I have also had to urge to pee often. I do not take any medications, eat well, sleep well, take vitamins and am not over weight. I'm at a loss for what is causing these issues.
title: Why do I feel this way
